definition: to run/to run away/to escape/to run around (on errands etc)/(of a gas or liquid) to leak or evaporate/(verb complement) away/off
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next
to run/to run away/to escape/to run around (on errands etc)/(of a gas or liquid) to leak or evaporate/(verb complement) away/off

to go/to go to (a place)/(of a time etc) last/just passed/to send/to remove/to get rid of/to reduce/to be apart from in space or time/to die (euphemism)/to play (a part)/(when used either before or after a verb) to go in order to do sth/(after a verb of motion indicates movement away from the speaker)/(used after certain verbs to indicate detachment or separation)

sentences.english: They love to run about on the beach.
sentences.chinese: 他们喜欢在海滩上跑来跑去。

sentences.english: That child flits about like a wraith.
sentences.chinese: 那个孩子像幽灵一样飞快地跑来跑去。

sentences.english: As soon as the alarm went, the crew raced around shutting the watertight doors.
sentences.chinese: 警报一响，船员们跑来跑去把船上的水密门关紧。

sentences.english: A brace of tame deer ran familiarly about the house.
sentences.chinese: 一对驯鹿无拘无束地在室内跑来跑去。

sentences.english: I would rather hoe in the garden than run on the playground.
sentences.chinese: 我宁愿在花园里锄草，不愿在运动场上跑来跑去。

sentences.english: Don't chase about any more and sit down quickly.
sentences.chinese: 别再跑来跑去了，赶快坐下来。

sentences.english: As soon as the alarm went, the crew raced about shouting the watertight doors.
sentences.chinese: 警报一响，船员们跑来跑去把船上的水密门关紧。

sentences.english: I would rather hoe in the garden than run about on the playground.
sentences.chinese: 我宁愿在花园里锄草，不愿在运动场上跑来跑去。

sentences.english: She raced about the house to get her work done.
sentences.chinese: 她在屋里跑来跑去要把自己的工作搞完。

sentences.english: Toddlers like to run around the house bare naked .
sentences.chinese: 刚会走路的孩子喜欢光着脚在房子周围跑来跑去。

sentences.english: The other people all in to have a meal, but xiaoyan run to give everybody end dish.
sentences.chinese: 别人都在吃饭，唯独晓燕跑来跑去给大家端菜。

sentences.english: In primitive times man went without clothing.
sentences.chinese: 在原始时代人光着身子跑来跑去。

sentences.english: Don't crash about upstairs while I'm working.
sentences.chinese: 我工作时，别在楼上咚咚地跑来跑去。

sentences.english: A lot of students enjoy running around the playground during their break time.
sentences.chinese: 很多学生喜欢在下课休息时间，在操场上跑来跑去。

sentences.english: The company commander was running around and shouting that we should dig like crazy.
sentences.chinese: 连长跑来跑去，喊着让我们玩命地挖战壕。

sentences.english: They rushed about helter-skelter collecting dung and carrying earth.
sentences.chinese: 他们忙慌乱乱地跑来跑去拾粪担土。
